title: Death toll in great earthquakes as of 2016
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Death toll for 10 number of Earthquakes.
The Death toll is highest at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and lowest at Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).
The highest Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has 168662.0 more Death toll than the lowest Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Earthquake in the x axis and Death toll in the y axis.
The Death toll is appeared to be the highest at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and lowest at Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Death toll for 10 number of Earthquakes.
The Death toll is appeared to be the highest at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and lowest at Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
The Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll, followed by , and Nanchang (China 1927). Down to the Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) which is the lowest.
The Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has 1.61 times more Death toll than average.
